items.content:
Hi Andrew,


Would you please describe further on what support you need regarding SKAN 4.0 transition?
I was advised by our PSO team to make a ticket with MPO team to help us get the client set-up on SKAN 4.0.

Hi Andrew,

Is the client on the allowlist for SKAN 4.0? SKAN 4.0 is currently not GA, so I am trying to clarify more background on your request. 

Can I ask which PSO member you were speaking to? Maybe I can talk to the person and clarify further.

Hi Andrew,

I checked with Joe and understand you are looking for technical guidance on the process for transition etc.

I went through the configs and confirm that they actually configured it every well. They are already good to go for SKAN 4.0 transition.

Should you need more details, you can read from:

https://bytedance.sg.larkoffice.com/docx/IdnDd2wErog3kux09SplapBegLb


  • Client has already configured very well for both Fine and Coarse grained schema. No issue found with partner event mapping as well.
  • The only thing to point out is that the client was currently utilising 20 out of 64 schema values. I think current config already covers most of actions within the app, so it should be good. But should there be any mid-funnel event they want to measure additionally, they may do so.

Thanks Cham! 

Do you know what are the next steps in getting them transitioned to SKAN 4.0 in TTAM?

SKAN 4.0 is currently on beta, so you will need to request allowlist to transition.

https://bytedance.us.larkoffice.com/docx/C3kudpmOxoEU7exlM0auejEMsJg


But, as far as I am aware, SKAN 4.0 will be in GA in March, so you can alternatively choose to wait instead unless your client is in.a rush. For the exact timeline, you may consult Joe for more details.

For GA once released, client will need to do single click on TTAM for transition.

https://bytedance.us.larkoffice.com/docx/C3kudpmOxoEU7exlM0auejEMsJg#YU9xdwDAsoUX6UxIXmQut1uxsob

Hi Cham, 

Sorry to reopen this ticket but a quick question from the client: 
"Now that TikTok has confirmed SKAN 4.0 is live as of 3/8, can we work to confirm postback events are being attributed accurately in AppsFlyer with the goal being that we eventually switch our conversion optimization event to Trials." 

I believe nothing on our end, but just wanted to double check if that seems right on your end too?

Hi Andrew,

I can confirm that we are receiving SKAN 4.0 postbacks from Apple!

Sorry to reopen this again: 
But another question from the client: 
"We're not seeing any D3-D35 SKAN 4 extended postbacks yet, so we want to understand (1) how we can validate the impact of the D3+ coarse conversion values, and (2) how TT plans to share with AF the utilization of the additional 2x fine conversion values, specifically with respect to creative-level attribution for post-install events."

Also they are looking to sync with our team & Appsflyer team to discuss "how this affects our optimization events and reporting?"

Would you be the best person for that or can you recommend someone who is? 

Thank you again!

Hi Andrew,


I actually see D3-D7 postbacks (Postback window #2) on their account. Note that this client mapped LaunchApp, Subscribe, StartTrial event for the coarse values in their schema, so you will need to manually select these events in TTAM and check the metrics of each event respectively.


Custom Columns > In-app event (SKAN) > Select LaunchApp, Subscribe, StartTrial event and tick specific metrics you want to see > click Confirm on the right bottom.


Once you click Breakdown: SKAN postback sequence, right next to Custom Columns, you can see the numbers for postback window 2 as below. As you can see, right now, users only launched the app but did not proceed to subscribe or start trial, so only launchapp has some numbers.



For your rest of questions,
- how TT plans to share with AF the utilization of the additional 2x fine conversion values, specifically with respect to creative-level attribution for post-install events.

>> For the increased volume of fine conversion values, we are already sharing the data we received with Appsflyer. In terms of creative-level attribution, I believe the client is referring to source id.

We used to have 2-digit campaign ID in SKAN 3, which you could use it to attribute to campaign-level. We now have 4-digit ID called Source ID in SKAN 4, which you can use two additional digits for more precise measurement. But since it is only two more digits, the way you can utilise is pretty limited. We may use two more digits for creative-level attribution, or for geographic-level attribution, or for something else, but two digits are not enough to do everything. Plus, two additional digits are NOT always guaranteed. Depending on crowd anonymity (New concept replacing Privacy threshold), we may receive between 2-4 digit source IDs.

Given that, the way we utilise two more digits, whether we use it for creative-level attribution or something else, is not fixed yet, and it can change over the time.


Here is an official communication guideline from PSO:

https://bytedance.us.larkoffice.com/docx/IrRrdUdSoo6QTkxcAi1uemBmshe

The Source Identifier is used by TikTok when we register impressions or clicks with Apple. We inform Apple's ATT framework within the user's iOS device, whether it was an impression or a click, with a network identifier (to identify TikTok) and a source identifier, which, on our side, we will map to a TikTok campaign.

When Apple sends us a conversion value postback (which could be up to 94 days after the click due to their lookback windows), the postback will contain a 6-bit conversion value (or a coarse conversion value), alongside a source identifier, for us to be able to attribute the conversion to a specific campaign.

With the new addition of 2 digits, TikTok can encode more data into the impression or click, which, when returned, can be used for different purposes. However, since there's no expectation that we will be receiving 100% of the full 4-digit source identifier, we know that anything encoded into those digits will require us to reconstruct it and model it back.

Designing high-confidence models requires data at scale. The adoption of SKAN 4.0 at the moment is still low. Once we have more data, with the increased adoption of more apps, we will have a clear idea of how to maximize these 2 digits to provide the highest value for you. The more apps transition to SKAN 4.0, the closer we get to the minimum threshold needed for a highly confident model.



Also they are looking to sync with our team & Appsflyer team to discuss "how this affects our optimization events and reporting?"

Our team normally help engaging with the client, but for implementation related questions mainly. I would like more context on the question first as it is a little vague for me, but if their questions are not deep-dive and can be covered by existing comm docs or FAQs already available, our team can try to help. However, if they wish to discuss this topic in deep-dive, such as our optimization model and future plans on that, so I think it is better you run by PSO first and seek for assistance on this.

Sorry another question from the client: 

We had some additional questions regarding Postback window 2 - I pulled this view for 3/13-3/27 and can confirm we do see data coming in for the launch app event but not for any other event. Given the volume of 1st postback events we see for the other conversion events, is it normal not to see any 2nd Postback events for these?  Do we need to make any adjustments to our postback measurement set up?

Given the volume of 1st postback events we see for the other conversion events, is it normal not to see any 2nd Postback events for these?  Do we need to make any adjustments to our postback measurement set up?


I would say it is natural not to see other events for 2nd postback.

  • Free Trial in 2nd postback would indicate the users who installed the app but never started free trial during Day 1-Day 2 (Postback 1) but who started trial during Day 3-Day 7 (Postback 2). We are not seeing any users who started free trial in D3-D7, but D1-D2. I personally think that is a good sign since users are willing to try free trial straightaway rather than considering for a few days.

  • In 1st postback, there were 23 users who started FreeTrial. During 2nd postback window (D3-D7), these users will not trigger FreeTrial since they are already on trial. Hence we may not see another FreeTrial conversions from these users.
    Instead, these users may trigger LaunchApp or Subscription (for paid subscription). But I see your app is currently offering 7 day trial (https://www.onepeloton.com/app-membership/app-one/monthly), so I would say you will less likely to see Subscribe events in Postback 2 because the users are still on free trial period until D7 unless there are any users who willingly converted to Subscribe even before their free trial ends, or who skipped trial but went straight to subscription.


So, in summary, I would say we would see FreeTrial numbers in Postback 2 or 3, but the numbers would be a lot less than what we would see in Postback 1. Given we had 23 free trial in Postback 1 so far, if the installs and free trial in Postback 1 increase, we may start seeing free trial in postback 2 and 3 in parallel.
For Subscribe, I am not sure whether it is mandatory or optional to go on free trial, but if it is mandatory we may less likely to see in Postback 2 but see some Postback 3 instead.
